description: The National Food Security Mission (NFSM), launched in 2007, aims to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, and coarse cereals through improved seeds, inputs, and practices.
key_features: Subsidized seeds, fertilizers, and farm equipment
Targets 13 million tonnes additional foodgrain production

criteria: Farmers growing rice, wheat, pulses, or coarse cereals
Priority to small and marginal farmers

steps: Register for input subsidies or demonstrations
